column4: i tried to apt-get upgrade to dapper, but now my system won't boot.  how can i recover it from this breezy live cd?
is there any way for me to complete the apt-get upgrade?
right now, when i boot up, it gets to "detecting pcmcia devices" and freezes.  i don't have a pcmcia device on this machine.
boot from livecd, mount your root and then do chroot /therootdir
you could also try to modify boot parameters
it would probably be good to complete the apt-get upgrade first.
yep, you can do it by booting, mounting the root, chrooting the root and then just typing the apt-get dist-upgrade
you can install macos on pc also ;)
how can i list my mountable volumes?  i'm brain dead tired right now.
did you try the line i gave?
forgot to write it down. sorry.  could you repeat?
you could also try to boot from livecd once more and remove pcmcia-package
